str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
A primary particle of emphasis or qualification.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I remain, tarry, (b) I remain in, persist in. From epi and meno; to stay over, i.e. Remain.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To found, lay the foundation (lit. and met.). From themelios; to lay a basis for, i.e. erect, or consolidate.
And, even, also, namely.
Sitting, seated; steadfast, firm. From a derivative of hezomai; sedentary, i.e. immovable.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Trans: I move away, dislodge, remove. From meta and kineo; to stir to a place elsewhere, i.e. Remove.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Hope, expectation, trust, confidence. From a primary elpo; expectation or confidence.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Neuter Singular
str2: To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From ktizo; original formation.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Probably from an obsolete diako; an attendant, i.e. a waiter; specially, a Christian teacher and pastor.
